image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Luigi Mangione’s social media activity: From anti-pornography stance to critique of modern society
item.description: Luigi Mangione, a 26-year-old University of Pennsylvania graduate and UnitedHealthcare murder suspect, held diverse political views online. He criticized modern conveniences, Japanese adult products, and societal decline, citing authors like Huxley and Kaczynski. He also advocated for traditional interactions and weightlifting, drawing parallels between contemporary America and the fall of Rome.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Polygamous sect leader in Arizona gets 50 years in prison in conspiracy to transport children for sex
item.description: Polygamous cult leader Samuel Bateman, 48, received a 50-year sentence for sexually exploiting and kidnapping underage girls. He pleaded guilty to transporting minors for sexual activity and kidnapping. His "wives," some as young as 9, testified about their trauma. Bateman's followers included minors and adults from troubled backgrounds.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Inside 'Rail Force One': The trains that take world leaders to Ukraine
Trudeau survives no-confidence vote: Tories' 3rd attempt to topple Canadian PM fails
item.description: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau's government survived its third no-confidence vote on Tuesday. The opposition Conservatives, led by Pierre Poilievre, failed to topple the minority Liberal government. The NDP, despite recent criticism of Trudeau, sided with the Liberals, defeating the motion 180-152.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump selects Mark Paoletta as general counsel of the office of management and budget
item.description: Donald Trump has appointed Mark Paoletta as general counsel to the Office of Management and Budget for his prospective second term. Paoletta, a former White House official and lawyer, will focus on cutting government spending and advancing Trump's agenda, collaborating with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE).
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Luigi Mangione 'became quiet and started to shake' as cops confront him at McDonald's over CEO murder
item.description: Luigi Mangione, the prime suspect in the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, was arrested at a Pennsylvania McDonald's after a customer recognized him. Police found a 3D-printed pistol, silencer, and ammunition in his backpack. Mangione's arrest sparked online backlash, with some criticizing the tipster and others boycotting McDonald's in protest.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Mutilated, burned in street': Nearly 200 voodoo practitioners killed in Haiti massacre
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: #FreeLuigi takes over social media: Why are people rallying behind a man arrested in CEO's murder?
item.description: Luigi Mangione, arrested in the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, has garnered unexpected support online. A ghost gun, suppressor, and anti-healthcare manifesto were found in his possession. Social media users, fueled by anger towards the US healthcare system, are rallying behind Mangione, viewing him as a symbol of resistance against corporate greed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Luigi Mangione, suspect in the UnitedHealth CEO shooting?
item.description: Luigi Mangione, a 26-year-old former data engineer with a privileged background, has been arrested in connection with the fatal shooting of a UnitedHealth Group executive. Police found him with a homemade gun and an anti-capitalist manifesto. Mangione's online activity reveals admiration for the Unabomber and potential struggles with chronic back pain, raising questions about his motive.

item.title: Rupert Murdoch loses fight to change family trust
item.description: Rupert Murdoch's attempt to grant his eldest son, Lachlan, sole control of his media empire has been blocked by a Nevada probate commissioner. The commissioner ruled that Murdoch acted in "bad faith" when trying to alter the family trust. Murdoch plans to appeal the decision, while his other children welcomed the ruling, hoping to mend family relationships.

item.title: Donald Trump endorses KC Crosbie after Lara steps down as RNC co-chair
item.description: KC Crosbie has been appointed as the new co-chair of the Republican National Committee, succeeding Lara Trump. Trump praised Crosbie's experience and commitment to election integrity. Lara Trump is considering a run for Marco Rubio's Senate seat if he is confirmed as Secretary of State. Trump commended Lara Trump's contributions to the RNC's fundraising success and strengthening of the party.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Rebels assert control in Damascus, their plans still unclear
item.description: Rebel forces, Hayat Tahrir al-Sham, have seized control of Damascus, ending the Assad family's rule in Syria. Uncertainty surrounds the new leadership as Syrians return home amidst fears of retribution and lawlessness. Israel continues strikes within Syria, while Russia grants asylum to Assad. Arab nations reassess regional dynamics with Assad's ousting.

item.title: Assad's PM says he has agreed to hand over power to rebels
item.description: Rebel leader Ahmed al-Sharaa (formerly known as Abu Mohammed al-Golani) met with Syrian Prime Minister Mohammed Jalali and Vice-President Faisal Mekdad to discuss a transitional government. Jalali agreed to transfer power to the rebel "Salvation Govt," led by Mohammed al-Bashir, who is expected to become the new prime minister. The meeting focused on ensuring continued services for the Syrian people.

item.title: European countries pause asylum claims
item.description: Following the rebel takeover of Damascus and President Assad's flight to Russia, the UK, Germany, and Austria have paused Syrian asylum applications. Millions of Syrians, displaced by 13 years of civil war, had sought refuge in neighboring countries and Europe, including over 20,000 resettled in the UK by February 2021.

item.title: 'System is rigged': Jordan Neely's father reacts after Daniel Penny found not guilty in chokehold death
item.description: Daniel Penny, 26, was acquitted of all charges in the chokehold death of Jordan Neely, a homeless man, on a New York City subway. The verdict sparked protests and outrage from Neely's family, who plan to pursue civil action. The jury deliberated for four days before finding Penny not guilty of criminally negligent homicide.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Brian Thompson murder suspect Luigi Mangione: Heir to real estate fortune, brother to doctor, linked to Republican delegate
item.description: Luigi Mangione, heir to a Maryland resort fortune, has been arrested in connection with the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. Apprehended in Pennsylvania, Mangione possessed a "ghost gun," silencer, and a manifesto railing against healthcare industry profits. The investigation into Thompson's December 4th shooting continues.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Luigi Mangione arrest: Ghost gun, mask, anti-corporate writings found on suspect in CEO’s killing, says Police
item.description: Luigi Nicholas Mangione, 26, was arrested in Altoona, Pennsylvania, for the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. Police found a ghost gun, mask, and writings expressing anti-corporate sentiment. Mangione, a University of Pennsylvania graduate, was identified via surveillance footage and a tip. The killing has heightened corporate security concerns.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Inside 'Rail Force One': The trains that take world leaders to Ukraine
Trump nominates Indian American lawyer Harmeet K Dhillon as assistant attorney general for civil rights
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump nominated Indian American lawyer Harmeet K. Dhillon for Assistant Attorney General for Civil Rights. Dhillon, a prominent election lawyer and defender of civil liberties, will focus on ensuring fair elections and upholding constitutional rights in her new role at the Department of Justice.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Penny acquitted: After Daniel walks free, what legal options remain for Jordan Neely’s family?
item.description: A Manhattan jury acquitted Daniel Penny in the chokehold death of Jordan Neely, sparking debate about mental health, crime, and race. Neely's legal team may pursue a civil lawsuit for damages or advocate for policy reforms. The defense successfully argued self-defense, while prosecutors contended the chokehold was excessive.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
